content: My name is John McCombs, and I am a Ph.D. student in Civil Engineering at the University of Central Florida. My research focuses on improving traffic operations and safety in Florida using statistical modeling and data science. Working with Professor Haitham Al-Deek, Ph.D., P.E., I have contributed to projects on preventing wrong-way driving on limited access facilities, developing safety performance functions for intersections, and analyzing the impacts of disabled and abandoned vehicles on limited access facilities. My most recent project, which is the subject of my Ph.D., is developing a corridor safety approach using both crash and non-crash data to identify high-risk suburban and urban roadways where crashes and fatalities can be reduced. In my spare time, I like to play video games, crochet, and explore American mid-century pop culture and media.
summary: My name is John McCombs, and I am a Ph.D. student in Civil Engineering at the University of Central Florida. My research focuses on improving traffic operations and safety in Florida using statistical modeling and data science.
title: John McCombs

content: The UCF Today news site has written about how one of the journal papers our research team submitted to the Transportation Research Board received the the Best Young Professional Paper Award. To read the full article, check it out here. For more information on the paper and to read it, click here.
summary: The UCF Today news site has written about how one of the journal papers our research team submitted to the Transportation Research Board received the the Best Young Professional Paper Award.
title: Research Team Featured in UCF Today for Receiving Paper Award

content: From February 2019 through February 2022, I was the President of the UCF Student Chapter of ITE. For the 2020-2021 year, our chapter received the Student Chapter Momentum Award from the Florida Puerto Rico District of ITE (FLPRITE). This award is designed to recognize a student chapter that has experienced the greatest momentum/improvement in the past year. During the period, our membership increased from 5 members to 32 members, the largest growth the chapter has on record. Our chapter also added more officer positions to help grow the club. For more information, check out the annual report that I primarily authored that helped us win the award here.
summary: From February 2019 through February 2022, I was the President of the UCF Student Chapter of ITE. For the 2020-2021 year, our chapter received the Student Chapter Momentum Award from the Florida Puerto Rico District of ITE (FLPRITE).
title: UCF ITE Student Chapter was selected for the ITE Florida Puerto Rico District 2020-2021 Student Chapter Momentum Award

content: This paper was presented at TRB 2022. The presentation is available here.
summary: This paper investigates the impact RRs have on disabled vehicle events and identifies roads with potential for expansion of RR patrol hours by analyzing 2019 incident and crash data.
title: Analyzing Disabled Vehicle Incident Durations and Crash Response to Identify Service Patrol Expansions and Reduce the Need for Law Enforcement Involvement

content: The UCF Pegasus Magazine wrote an article in their Spring 2021 issue about the UCF researchers making driving safer, smarter, and more sustainable. One section of the article focuses on the wrong-way driving research our research team has worked on. The full article can be read on the Pegasus Magazine website here or in this PDF of the article as it appeared in the printed magazine.
summary: The UCF Pegasus Magazine wrote an article in their Spring 2021 issue about the UCF researchers making driving safer, smarter, and more sustainable. One section of the article focuses on the wrong-way driving research our research team has worked on.
title: Research Team Featured in Pegasus Magazine

content: Welcome to my website! I made this site to primarily serve as an online CV of sorts, but I hope to post some projects and articles/posts as well. Stay tuned for more!
summary: Welcome to my website! I made this site to primarily serve as an online CV of sorts, but I hope to post some projects and articles/posts as well. Stay tuned for more!
title: Welcome to my website!

content: This paper was the recipient of the 2022 Best TRB Freeway Operations Committee Young Professional/Student Paper Award. Its associated TRB 2022 presentation is available here.
summary: WWD detection data from 48 toll road exit ramps were modeled to identify the factors that affect WWD frequency.
title: Using Wrong-Way Driving Detection Data to Identify Factors That Affect Wrong-Way Driving Behavior and Compare Detection Technologies

content: This presentation was sponsored by the Standing Committee on Traffic Law Enforcement (ACS30). Its associated paper number was TRBAM-22-01574. It was later published in Transportation Research Record and is available here.
summary: Analyzing Disabled Vehicle Incident Durations and Crash Response to Identify Service Patrol Expansions and Reduce the Need for Law Enforcement Involvement
title: TRB 2022: Advancing Safety Through Traffic Law Enforcement

content: This presentation was sponsored by the Standing Committee on Freeway Operations (ACP20) and Standing Committee on Regional Transportation Systems Management and Operations (ACP10). Its associated paper number was TRBAM-22-01598. It was later published in Transportation Research Record and is available here. Note that although I was not the lead author, I presented the poster due to the main author being unable to attend.
summary: Using Wrong-Way Driving Detection Data to Identify Factors That Affect Wrong-Way Driving Frequency and Behavior and Compare Detection Technologies
title: TRB 2022: Freeway and Regional Transportation Systems and Operations 2022

summary: Use of Crowdsourced Data to Obtain Early Warning Alerts for Disabled and Abandoned Vehicles
title: FAV 2021 Summit

content: This paper was presented at TRB 2021. The presentation is available here.
summary: Safety engineers from 42 DOTs across the United States were surveyed about their stateâ€™s current SPF development practices and context classification.
title: Using context classification to develop intersection Safety Performance Functions: national survey of current practices and evaluation of benefits for rural Florida intersections

summary: Two types of comparisons were used to evaluate the benefits of context-specific SPFs for the C3R-Suburban Residential and C4-Urban General context categories.
title: Evaluating the benefits of using a context classification system to develop intersection safety performance functions

summary: In this paper, eight individual intersection group SPFs were developed for the C3R-Suburban Residential and C4-Urban General categories and compared with full SPFs for these categories.
title: Regional Perspective of Safety Performance Functions and Their Application to Florida Intersections in Suburban Residential and Urban General Context Classification Categories

content: This presentation was sponsored by the Standing Committee on Regional Transportation Systems Management and Operations (ACP10). Its associated paper number was TRBAM-21-00078. It was later published in Advances in Transportation Studies and is available here.
summary: A Regional Perspective on Safety Performance Function Development and Implementation: National Survey of Current Regional Practices and Evaluation of Crash Predictions for Rural Florida Intersections
title: TRB 2021: Regional Transportation Systems Management and Operations 2021

summary: In this paper, a WWCR segment model and WWD countermeasures optimization algorithm are developed for all Florida limited access facilities (56 roadways with 1,375 exits) to identify the optimal locations for ITS countermeasure deployment.
title: Statewide Application of Wrong-Way Driving Crash Risk Modeling and Countermeasures Optimization Algorithm to Identify Optimal Locations for Countermeasure Deployment on Florida Limited Access Facilities

content: This paper was presented at TRB 2022. The presentation is available here.
summary: This final report discusses the results from our project on developing SPFs for FDOT's context classification system.
title: A Roadway Context Classification Approach for Developing Safety Performance Functions and Determining Traffic Operational Effects for Florida Intersections

summary: This research developed SPFs based on a new context classification system used by the Florida Department of Transportation (FDOT) which categorizes intersections into eight different categories.
title: Developing context-specific safety performance functions for Florida intersections to more accurately predict intersection crashes
